Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Veo is a global leader in AI-based sports camera technology. Our innovative, fully automatic camera solution enables sports teams to record matches and training sessions without a camera operator. We’re democratizing the world of sports by granting video analysis for teams on all levels—a privilege that used to be only for the few. More than 40,000 clubs in 90+ countries record their games every week.

Growing as fast as we do in Veo means that every day is different, exciting, and challenging, both on the front line and in the back office.

But that’s not the most remarkable thing about us.

The coolest thing is our people. We’ve attracted some of the brightest minds in the industry. They are the reason we can create a great product and do it while enjoying ourselves.

As a Machine Learning Engineer at Veo you will get to work on challenging problems and directly contribute to the value created by our AI-driven end-user products.

You will become part of our AI team, which comprises 15 researchers and engineers responsible for all stages in the machine learning lifecycles across different projects – from scoping and defining data annotation tasks to modeling, validation, and deployment. You will be free to determine the directions of the project you work on while also getting feedback and being encouraged to spar with the rest of the team to assist each other in improving and succeeding.

We stay current with the latest research and continuously discuss concepts and ideas in recent papers to assess their relevance to our tasks and product-specific challenges.

We are looking to add yet another ambitious, high-performing junior to senior engineer/researcher with proven experience from real-world machine learning projects to the team. Experience with computer vision is advantageous but not a must.

What you will do:



Train state-of-the-art machine learning models
Write efficient inference pipelines for cloud and edge
Define and supervise data annotation tasks
Improve evaluation schemes to increase understanding of model performance and shortcomings
Contribute to long-term planning and prioritization of tasks




What you will need:



MSc or PhD in a relevant field
Hands-on experience with real-world, large-scale machine-learning projects
Great coding skills
Skilled at both autonomous tasks and contributing to group efforts
Ability to examine details closely and critically




At Veo, you'll be part of a thriving work environment where every day brings new excitement. Our rapid growth ensures a diverse and ever-changing atmosphere. We believe in work-life balance and providing a positive culture that allows you to thrive personally and professionally.

Our Copenhagen office mirrors our innovative technology – with an indoor ball court, rooftop terrace, and well-equipped gym. We have created a facility that supports connecting disciplines across the business, facilitates creative thinking, and gives the space to engage with colleagues, our global partners, and the entire Veo community.

Diversity and differences are valuable assets for us. We value diversity and inclusion and welcome people from all backgrounds. If you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we still encourage you to apply.

We’re committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. And you may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Still interested? Join us at Veo and become a part of a team that delivers greatness and has a great time doing it.

We will invite for interviews continuously, so apply with LinkedIn or your resume as soon as possible.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We're looking for a Data Scientist for our client within pharma




The preferred candidate can:

Assist us in setting up DataDog for monitoring
Assist us in setting up the connection to the data gathered for an App (that they are in progress of developing)
Start/end date: 3 week of January (or later) (we are flexible in regards to get the best candidate)




​​​​​​​Full time for 2-3 week




English is a prerequisite.




Start-date: 6/1-2025

End-date: 24/1-2025

Location: Søborg

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Kongens Lyngby, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
A personal note to “You?” our future team member

Fast forward a year: We’re gathered as a team, celebrating the remarkable successes we’ve achieved together. The enterprise clients we’ve partnered with—leaders in retail, utilities, and manufacturing—are sharing how our solutions have reshaped their operations, increased efficiency, and unlocked new opportunities for growth.




You’ve been at the heart of these successes. You’ve delivered impactful projects, streamlined complex processes, and built trust with clients. Along the way, you’ve honed your technical and consulting skills—whether mastering advanced machine learning techniques, refining your ability to turn data into strategic insights, or navigating the unique challenges of enterprise-level consulting.




Your problem-solving and innovative ideas have not only driven client success but also inspired growth within our team. And today, we’re not just celebrating results; we’re celebrating our team, the journey and the pioneering difference we’ve have made for all our customers - together.




About Us

We are dedicated to driving data-driven transformation for enterprise clients in retail, utilities, and manufacturing. Our focus is on optimizing processes and delivering measurable impact through cutting-edge AI and Data Science solutions.

We believe in empowering our teams to take ownership and act as self-driven consultants. Our projects range from optimizing supply chains to enhancing customer experiences—all leveraging advanced Data Science and AI techniques.




The Role

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will play a pivotal role in shaping and delivering cutting-edge solutions for our enterprise customers. You’ll work closely with client stakeholders to understand their processes, identify opportunities for optimization, and implement models and strategies that drive business results.




Key Responsibilities

Collaborate with enterprise customers to identify and understand their business challenges.
Design and implement machine learning models, algorithms, and data-driven strategies to optimize processes and enhance decision-making.
Translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations for non-technical stakeholders.
Lead project teams, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality solutions.
Act as a trusted advisor, guiding clients through their data-driven transformation journey.
Mentor junior team members, fostering a culture of learning and growth.
Your own budget and achieving it, as well as contributing to the involvement and employment of others




What We’re Looking For

Experience: 5+ years in data science or similar, preferably in consultancy or enterprise settings.
Technical Expertise: Extensive experience with Python programming. Familiarity with some of our primary libraries is an advantage: Pandas, PySpark, MLFlow, scikit-learn, Dash. Experience with/basic knowledge of Cloud services, such as Microsoft Azure, Azure Machine Learning, Azure Databricks, Microsoft Fabric, Data Lake, and Blob.
Business Acumen: Ability to understand and optimize business processes in retail, utility, or manufacturing.
Consulting Skills: Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with experience in client-facing roles.
Self-Driven: Capable of working independently and leading projects from concept to delivery.




Please note: If the above sounds interesting and you have experience that is relevant (transferable) to take on the responsibilities and tasks, we would be happy to explore your options with us.




What We Offer

A dynamic and collaborative work environment with a focus on innovation and impact.
Opportunities to work on diverse, high-impact projects with leading enterprise clients.
A strong culture of professional growth, with access to training, mentorship, and career development.
Competitive compensation and benefits package.




Send us your CV and a cover letter.

We’d love to hear about a project where you drove measurable business impact using data science techniques.




Best regards,

Philip Hoyos (Senior Director, AI & Data Science)

& Steffen Krogsgaard (Talent Acquisition Director)

Inspari - a valantic company

Show more

Title: Machine Learning/AI konsulenter
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Er du konsulent med erfaring i Machine Learning/AI, og er du bosiddende i Danmark, med minimum 5 års professionel erfaring fra IT relaterede projekter ude hos kunder, og har du ikke før haft kontakt med os, så kunne et partnerskab med emagine måske være interessant for dig?

emagine er et high-end konsulenthus med hovedkvarter i København, der leverer skræddersyede ydelser og ekspertise ved brug af et netværk af ekspertkonsulenter.

Som freelance konsulent kan du blive inddraget i opgaver, enten som ekspertrådgiver, som en del af et emagine team, eller som en betroet konsulent ude på opgave i en af vores kunders organisation.

I Danmark har vi kontorer i København, Aarhus og Aalborg, med over 900 konsulenter ude på opgaver lige nu. I Europa har vi over 5.000 konsulenter på opgave.

Tilmeld dig vores database og få muligheden for at arbejde med nogle af de mest innovative virksomheder i branchen.

At blive medlem af vores konsulentdatabase har mange fordele, herunder:


Adgang til en bred vifte af projekter med internationale virksomheder, så du kan anvende dine færdigheder og ekspertise til projekter, der betyder noget.
Opgaver, der matcher dine færdigheder og ekspertise, hvilket sikrer, at du arbejder på projekter, der stemmer overens med dine styrker.
Kurser og kompetenceudvikling på alle niveauer med særlig erfaring inden for undervisning i projekt- program- og porteføljeledelse.
Muligheder for at udvide din portefølje af projekter og fremme din karriere


Som konsulent med Machine Learning/AI kompetencer, bør du have erfaring med en del af følgende:


Artifical Intelligence (AI)
Machine Learning (ML)
Python
Deep Learning
SQL
Neurale Netværk
Large Language Model (LLM)
Java
Docker
R
Algoritmer
NLP Engineering
Kubernetes
Show more

Title: R&D Scientist - Applied Food Protection Research
Description:
Job Summary

We are seeking a highly motivated Scientist in Food Science Research to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in food science and a passion for innovation in the food industry, preferably with knowledge about antimicrobials and their interaction with food matrices.


Understand different food matrices and their interactions with antimicrobials to design and conduct antimicrobial screenings in applications.
Collaborate closely with R&D and application colleagues in a multicultural environment to address customer and matrix requirements.
Utilize blending techniques to create new and improved food protection formulations.
Employ high-throughput methods for efficient and rapid testing of food samples.
Support the scale-up process to production and assist in supply chain management and regulatory review.
Write technical reports and present findings to key stakeholders.
Review patents and scientific articles and propose research initiatives aligned with business strategies and market trends.
Conduct data analysis to interpret results and drive decision-making processes.
Stay updated with the latest advancements in food science and apply this knowledge to ongoing projects.


Required Experience And Skills


The ideal candidate should hold at least a MSc in Food Science, Microbiology, or a related field.
Proficiency in techniques related to screening is necessary.
A couple of years of experience in project management is essential. Ideally, this experience should be gained in a food company.
Experience in high-throughput experimentation for antimicrobial efficacy testing.
Proficiency in statistical data analysis.
Self-motivation and the ability to take ownership of tasks and adapt to changing situations.
Effective communication and interpersonal skills for collaboration.
Strong ability to work in a cross-functional team environment.


We are a global leader in taste, scent, and nutrition, offering our customers a broader range of natural solutions and accelerating our growth strategy. At IFF, we believe that your uniqueness unleashes our potential. We value the diverse mosaic of the ethnicity, national origin, race, age, sex, or veteran status. We strive for an inclusive workplace that allows each of our colleagues to bring their authentic self to work regardless of their religion, gender identity & expression, sexual orientation, or disability.

Visit IFF.com/careers/workplace-diversity-and-inclusion to learn more
Show more

Title: Optimization Specialist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you talented at understanding deeply complex statistics and algorithms, and have a desire to apply that talent for implementations to solve real-world problems in collaboration with other academic and professional experts?




Do you have a ph.d. and deep expertise in one of the following topics: marketing/media mix models, embeddings, causal ML, Bayesian statistics, reinforcement learning, MCMC, deep neural nets, or stochastic sequential optimization? And would you love to learn about the remaining topics? Then we would very much love to meet you.




Our team is embarking on a highly strategic project at the intersection of data science, advertising technology, and audience insights, with a focus on privacy-friendly predictive modelling for audience segmentation and targeting. The system our team is designing will support 1/3rd of the world's ad campaigns, so the scope is huge. The success of our team depends on our ability in the near term to demonstrate to key stakeholders the superiority of our system, and then follow up on that promise in the mid-long term.




What You’ll Do:

Collaborate with a high-performing team to explore, design, and implement proprietary real-time campaign optimization algorithms models based on contemporary research papers, experimentation and original ideas. Your role will focus on researching, designing, and testing algorithms for optimizing the yield of advertising campaigns.
Act as a topic expert in communicating with stakeholders across the organization. You will explain to them what is done, and more importantly, why that is a great idea.
Work on the full software engineering lifecycle, from first design to initial implementation, to maintenance of stable products everyone relies on.




WhoYou Are:

You have a very strong academic background (PhD in Optimization research, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Data Science, or a related field).
You’re passionate about solving real-world problems with very advanced models and algorithms.
You have demonstrable experience coming up with original ideas and seeing them through to implementation.
You are a strong communicator who thrives in collaborative environments and is very curious and eager to learn from and mentor others. You know that you cannot always be right, and appreciate when others see the flaws in ideas first proposed by you.
You understand the virtue of building an 80% solution, and then iterating as needed afterwards.




Bonus Points:

If you have previous professional programming experience.




Why Join Us?

Be a key player in shaping the future of privacy-first advertising and audience modelling using cutting-edge AI techniques and highly performant compute systems.
Join an elite team where your research and technical contributions will have a direct impact on strategic outcomes. Work with massive, industry-scale data sets and the latest analytical and machine learning techniques.
Growth Opportunties; collaborate with leading minds in the field, present your work at major industry conferences, and push the boundaries of applied statistics and machine
learning.




If you’re ready to innovate and collaborate on high-stakes projects with real-world impact, apply now to join my team and help us redefine the future of audience modelling.

Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Intraday Power Trading
Description:
Senior Data Scientist - Intraday Power Trading

Jakob Bloch and Partners is currently supporting a proprietary trading power business as they expand their focus on the European short-term market. We are seeking a skilled professional to lead the European build out and collaborate closely with the Data Science team.




You:

3 to 5+ years of experience in short-term power trading analysis / data science.
Proven ability to construct forecasts and data/production tools tailored to the Continental energy markets.
Senior Data Scientist with experience in European continental short-term power markets, focusing ideally on the CWE region.




Tasks:

Identify and source relevant datasets and data flows essential for trading operations.
Develop forecasts and data tools to analyse various drivers of continental energy markets.
Collaborate with front-end developers to create visualisations for your analytical tools and forecasts.
Design new trading strategies upon identifying market inefficiencies.
Stay informed on industry developments that impact relevant data flows.




Work Environment:

Specialist proprietary trading firm.
Show more

Senior Data Scientist - Intraday Power Trading

Jakob Bloch and Partners is currently supporting a proprietary trading power business as they expand their focus on the European short-term market. We are seeking a skilled professional to lead the European build out and collaborate closely with the Data Science team.


You:

  • 3 to 5+ years of experience in short-term power trading analysis / data science.
  • Proven ability to construct forecasts and data/production tools tailored to the Continental energy markets.
  • Senior Data Scientist with experience in European continental short-term power markets, focusing ideally on the CWE region.


Tasks:

  • Identify and source relevant datasets and data flows essential for trading operations.
  • Develop forecasts and data tools to analyse various drivers of continental energy markets.
  • Collaborate with front-end developers to create visualisations for your analytical tools and forecasts.
  • Design new trading strategies upon identifying market inefficiencies.
  • Stay informed on industry developments that impact relevant data flows.


Work Environment:

  • Specialist proprietary trading firm.

Title: VIE _ DATA SCIENTIST (H/F) _ DANEMARK
Place: Esbjerg, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Contexte et environnement

Le/la titulaire du poste percevra une indemnité VIE selon le barème Business France.

Le logement sera fourni par la filiale.

Veuillez vérifier les conditions d’éligibilité au VIE sur le site internet mon-vie-via.businessfrance.fr .

Merci de candidater en anglais !

Activités

Rejoignez notre filiale TotalEnergies EP Denmark à Esbjerg !

Vous intégrerez l'équipe Transformation Digitale et Innovation de TotalEnergies Danemark, basée à Esbjerg. L'équipe a pour principale mission d'identifier des opportunités de développement de solutions digitales, par le biais de data exploration avancée, de prototypage, et selon les projets du développement de MVPs ou le transfert vers la Total Digital Factory. Les domaines couverts par l'équipe sont très nombreux : optimisation de production, réduction de l'empreinte carbone, la sécurité, la performance environnementale et industrielle, les activités offshore, notamment de maintenance, logistique, interventions sur les puits et installations, qui mobilisent des centaines de personnes sur un des complexes pétroliers offshore les plus complexes de la Mer du Nord. L'objectif affiché est de développer et déployer des solutions ambitieuses (prescriptives plutôt que descriptives) depuis l'exploration de données jusqu'au développement des apps et solutions en lien avec les utilisateurs.

Pour le poste proposé ici, le focus pourrait porter dans un premier temps sur la compréhension des causes et la minimisation des pertes de production, notamment liées aux défaillances de vannes, en utilisant des données de type realtime time series ; plusieurs use-cases en cours dans l'équipe dans le domaine de la performance opérationnelle exploitent des briques GenAI (Azure OpenAI notamment) et NLP, notamment pour enrichir les datasets, et conduiront certainement à des développements nouveaux. En plus de la maintenance de certains des use-cases en production, le poste est l’occasion d’être exposé à des sujets extrêmement variés, et a des techniques tout aussi variées.

En tant que data scientist dans le domaine industrielles, les missions principales seront les suivantes :


Ingénierie des fonctionnalités et modélisations avancées pour des études d’optimisation (recherche de points d’attention de performance industrielle/couts)
Analyse exploratoire, développement de cas d'usages, avec des subject matter experts
Etudes d’analyses sur la base des modèles développés ou données enrichies développées. A chaque fois qu’applicable, il s'agira de mettre en place des applications prescriptives, en format proof-of-concept, sur les thématiques à plus fort potentiel. L’équipe de développement/data engineering de l’équipe intervient en général à ce stade, mais il est fréquent que des profils complets enrichissent leur propre expérience en prenant grande part sinon le leadership sur ce volet.
Technology stacks : full python avec Dash/Plotly ou (le plus souvent) combinaison Python + React JS, en environnement Azure et/ou serveur. Vous devrez vous appuyer sur des proofs of concepts déjà lancés sur ces thématiques par le VIE que vous remplacerez, avant de développer/participer au développement de nouveaux proofs of concepts.



Profil du candidat

Formation recherchée :


Diplôme de Master avec une spécialisation en Data Science
Formation ingénieur de préférence



Compétences techniques :


Profil d'ingénieur avec une forte culture data / numérique et une curiosité pour notre industrie, et un souci des utilisateurs / clients
Bonne capacité d'analyse de données



Compétences informatiques:


Solide connaissance en science des données (Python) : très bonnes capacités à coder et à apprendre
Connaissance de Git
Expérience avec GenAI
La connaissance du LLM est un plus



Langues:


Anglais : niveau C1
Français : niveau B2
Danois : non obligatoire mais serait un plus



Informations supplémentaires

TotalEnergies valorise la diversité, promeut le développement individuel et offre des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous les candidats.
Show more
HTML:
Contexte et environnement

Le/la titulaire du poste percevra une indemnité VIE selon le barème Business France.

Le logement sera fourni par la filiale.

Veuillez vérifier les conditions d’éligibilité au VIE sur le site internet mon-vie-via.businessfrance.fr .

 Merci de candidater en anglais !

  • Bonne capacité d'analyse de données


Compétences informatiques:

  • La connaissance du LLM est un plus

Title: Remote AI Model-training Engineer (Part-time or Full time Contract)
Description:
Our client is a pioneering AI data company that has been advancing the development of AI applications for nearly a decade. They specialize in enabling large-scale, high-quality data solutions that support cutting-edge fields like generative AI, autonomous systems and are focused on expanding their AI capabilities to support a wide range of evaluations for public and private sector clients.

The Role

Our client is seeking skilled engineers to join their team in a contract role, with flexible options for part-time (minimum 20 hours per week) or full-time engagement. The role involves collecting, curating, and annotating AI data and code to train and evaluate AI models. In this role, you will review prompts and refine code as needed to ensure accurate, high-quality outputs. Your expertise will play a crucial part in enhancing response accuracy and improving overall system performance. This is a fantastic opportunity to work within a collaborative, dynamic environment and contribute to innovative projects.

Ideal Profile

Qualifications

This role focuses on practical tech skills, emphasizing problem-solving and adaptability in delivering high-quality AI solutions. Our client is seeking skilled engineers with the following qualifications:


Software Engineering Experience: A degree in Computer Science or a related field, with proficiency in programming languages like Java, C, C++, Python, Go, SQL, Node React, TypeScript, and/or MongoDB.
Team Player: Experience in working with or managing teams in dynamic, fast-paced environments.
Problem Solving & Communication: Strong English communication skills and an action-oriented mindset to tackle challenges effectively.
Self-Motivated & Goal-Oriented: You can work independently, are goal-driven, and thrive in a fully remote team environment.
Compensation: USD 15 - USD 25 per hour, depending on your skill set.


Shortlisted candidates will be invited to participate in a one-hour coding challenge, followed by a final interview for successful applicants. This contract role offers flexible working hours, with options for part-time (minimum 20 hours per week) or full-time engagement.

What's on Offer?


Flexible working options ( min 20 hours a week part-time or full time role)
Fully remote role
Work within a pioneering, fast growing AI data company
Show more

Title: Machine Learning/AI konsulenter
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Er du konsulent med erfaring i Machine Learning/AI, og er du bosiddende i Danmark, med minimum 5 års professionel erfaring fra IT relaterede projekter ude hos kunder, og har du ikke før haft kontakt med os, så kunne et partnerskab med emagine måske være interessant for dig?

emagine er et high-end konsulenthus med hovedkvarter i København, der leverer skræddersyede ydelser og ekspertise ved brug af et netværk af ekspertkonsulenter.

Som freelance konsulent kan du blive inddraget i opgaver, enten som ekspertrådgiver, som en del af et emagine team, eller som en betroet konsulent ude på opgave i en af vores kunders organisation.

I Danmark har vi kontorer i København, Aarhus og Aalborg, med over 900 konsulenter ude på opgaver lige nu. I Europa har vi over 5.000 konsulenter på opgave.

Tilmeld dig vores database og få muligheden for at arbejde med nogle af de mest innovative virksomheder i branchen.

At blive medlem af vores konsulentdatabase har mange fordele, herunder:


Adgang til en bred vifte af projekter med internationale virksomheder, så du kan anvende dine færdigheder og ekspertise til projekter, der betyder noget.
Opgaver, der matcher dine færdigheder og ekspertise, hvilket sikrer, at du arbejder på projekter, der stemmer overens med dine styrker.
Kurser og kompetenceudvikling på alle niveauer med særlig erfaring inden for undervisning i projekt- program- og porteføljeledelse.
Muligheder for at udvide din portefølje af projekter og fremme din karriere


Som konsulent med Machine Learning/AI kompetencer, bør du have erfaring med en del af følgende:


Artifical Intelligence (AI)
Machine Learning (ML)
Python
Deep Learning
SQL
Neurale Netværk
Large Language Model (LLM)
Java
Docker
R
Algoritmer
NLP Engineering
Kubernetes
Show more

Title: Python Developer
Place: Vejle Municipality, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Senior Software Engineer | Vejle | AWS | Python | SaaS Company




Location: Vejle, Denmark




Drive Innovation in Automotive Tech: Senior Software Engineer Role!

A leading company in automotive solutions is seeking a talented Senior Software Engineer to join their headquarters in Vejle, Denmark. Be part of a dynamic team that’s transforming the automotive industry.




Join Our Vision

We’re looking for a collaborative, solution-driven engineer with strong Python skills. This role offers a unique chance to influence the car trading market and shape future innovations.

At our company, we embrace challenges as opportunities for growth. Our teams are organized into specialized groups focused on solving real-world issues. In the Empower Space team, you’ll play a key role in streamlining vehicle buying and selling, helping clients thrive with impactful solutions. Join a collaborative squad dedicated to a specialized segment of our automotive trading platform, where your expertise will drive meaningful change!




Your Role and Impact

As an integral part of the tech and product teams, you’ll build reliable, scalable software that positions us as a leader in European car trading. Your technical skills will transform complex business requirements into intuitive and robust solutions.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and enhance software using Python, prioritizing efficiency, security, and scalability.
Take ownership of your code through all stages of development, from inception to deployment.
Identify and resolve system bottlenecks and bugs, improving performance and user satisfaction.
Work closely with an international team in an agile environment to drive continuous improvement.
Seek opportunities for professional development and stay updated on emerging technologies.




Core Skills Required:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science or a related field.
Proficiency in Python and object-oriented programming.
Experience with both relational and document-based databases.
Familiarity with design and architectural patterns and best practices in software development.
Strong problem-solving abilities, with expertise in debugging and code optimization.
Excellent communication skills in English; fluency in Danish is a plus.




Preferred Skills:

Experience with Agile/SCRUM methodologies.
Familiarity with Git, GitHub Actions, and AWS infrastructure.
Experience with RESTful API integration.




What Colleagues Say About You:

A team-oriented contributor who always goes above and beyond.
Positive, engaging, and a pleasure to work with.
Dependable in delivering high-quality work on schedule.
A team player with a competitive edge.




If this sounds like the right fit for you, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now and let’s connect!




About Us

We are a transparent digital B2B vehicle platform where automotive professionals can securely buy and sell vehicles through our online auction. Our platform includes a suite of integrated trading services such as on-site car appraisal, pricing guidance, secure transactions, and transport options, as well as a fully managed end-to-end selling service.




If you would like to learn more please contact Luqman Mohammed-Brown at L.Mohammed-Brown@tenthrevolution.com.

Show more
